sense.name: a unit of weight
sense.commentary: Two thousand pounds, or 2240 pounds in Britain.
sense.examples: A large truck can carry three-and-a-half tons of rock salt. Which weighs more: a ton of bricks, or a ton of feathers? The realization hit me like a ton of bricks.

sense.name: a lot, non-physically
sense.commentary: A general sense of "much" or "many", not intended as an actual measurement.
sense.examples: I've got a ton of work to do today. There are tons of ways to eat peanut butter. This game is tons of fun!
